title: FREE Amazon KDP Keyword Research Tools. Easily Find Hidden Low Content Book Niches.

tactics.name: A-Z Keyword Expansion
tactics.description: Systematically explore keywords by iterating through the alphabet to uncover niche variations and long-tail opportunities.
steps: Use Amazon's auto-suggestions with broad niches like 'coloring books'.
Iterate through the alphabet (A-Z) to generate keyword ideas.
Filter out branded terms (e.g., 'Disney') to avoid copyright risks.
caveats: Branded keywords may trigger copyright issues
source_quotes: we want to emulate the natural way a customer coming onto amazon looking for something to buy is likely to do

tactics.name: Product Detail Aggregation
tactics.description: Aggregate critical product data (BSR, categories, ISBN) without manual clicks using browser extensions.
steps: Install DS Amazon Quick View to display product details on search results.
Hover over product images to view BSR, categories, and publisher info.
Analyze aggregated data to assess niche viability.
caveats: Requires refresh for full data loading
source_quotes: this tool allows us to see the publisher, isbn, categories, and best sellers rank without clicking each book

tactics.name: hover_analysis
tactics.description: Use hover to extract BSR, publisher, page count, and review data without clicking books
steps: Hover over book to view BSR
Note page count and review numbers
source_quotes: we can see that the bsr is 113...hover over the book i'm now able to see the publisher

heuristics.name: Review Count Filter
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize niches with lower competition
source_quotes: we see the categories they went for and all that sort of information

heuristics.name: review_volume_heuristic
heuristics.condition: If book has fewer than 200 reviews, prioritize for niche validation
source_quotes: this book has 35 reviews...look at probably even better ranking books like this one with 108 reviews

claims.statement: Books with BSR under 100,000 are considered top-performing on Amazon
source_quotes: anything less than a hundred thousand is amazing

claims.statement: Books published by corporate entities like Rockbridge Press indicate professional production teams
source_quotes: when you see the publisher is something like rockbridge press...it's a big company with a massive budget

niche_patterns.description: Combine specific audience identities with unmet needs and limiting factors to identify underserved niches
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Balances demand with niche specificity to avoid oversaturation
source_quotes: we want to emulate the natural way a customer coming onto amazon looking for something to buy is likely to do
